intro: Holochlamys, commonly known as the African sand orchid, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, often strikingly colored flowers. The plants typically grow in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Holochlamys species are known for their intricate floral structures and are often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Their botanical significance lies in their ecological role and their value in horticultural collections.
